name: places/ChIJWxYVGIlZwokRO8i6UE7oTAc
formattedAddress: 200 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 200 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012-4079, USA

originalText.text:
Location is great, not too showy, only two floors. Store is in the smaller in size compare to other locations.

Service was excellent! I did not mind ordering our food all at once as I know it could be very busy at times. But the timing was great!

Food was great, bread was warm and fresh.
Pasta was a tad saltier but nothing I couldn’t eat. It was delish and creamy which I was craving. My company also enjoyed their food.

originalText.text:
As usual, Eataly is a great spot where to find all Italian, premium quality products! You can literally never go wrong!
This location gave more space to the restaurant, better enclosed than other locations, than to the actual market!
A bit pricey, but what do you expect?!
Highly recommended!
Enjoy the very nicely done restaurant for a business lunch or a cozy dinner!
Don’t forget it will get full of tourists too!

originalText.text:
Stopped in at their dessert bar. They have great selections and are very tasty to boot. I had the limoncello cake, awesome.
The attached grocery store is fun to browse. Some great choices for folks interested in authentic Italian cooking.

text.text:

The attached grocery store is fun to browse. Some great choices for folks interested in authentic Italian cooking.

originalText.text: Where should I begin. From the moment we walked in, we felt welcomed and comfortable. Our waiter was excellent and prompt. He kept us updated about our appetizer and meals the entire night. The management is top tier, whoever is running this establishment deserves an applause. Will be back, wonderful experience!! Picture of tiramisu for your viewing pleasure.

text.text: Where should I begin. From the moment we walked in, we felt welcomed and comfortable. Our waiter was excellent and prompt. He kept us updated about our appetizer and meals the entire night. The management is top tier, whoever is running this establishment deserves an applause. Will be back, wonderful experience!! Picture of tiramisu for your viewing pleasure.

originalText.text:
My boyfriend and I visited Eataly this past Saturday. It was an impromptu visit because the restaurant we were hoping to go to had a really long wait. Our experience there was fine. I wish I could give it a 3.5, but the stars don't let me go halfsies.

We got seated quickly and were greeted by a friendly waiter right away. Shout out to Manny. The menu was a bit confusing but we managed to get our orders in. To start we got a delicious calamari. Further, I got the linguine and my boyfriend got the rigatoni. My plate was great, I was honestly expecting a different sauce but I was pleasantly surprised. My boyfriends plate, although good, was lacking. We couldn't put our finger on it, but it just felt a tad unfulfilling.

The biggest issue we had was when we had to pay and the bartender or whoever is in charge of the payment portion, only put $50 in cash and charged the rest on the card, when in fact we had given them $90 in cash. It honestly felt like the person that had to charge us, NOT Manny, tried to pull a fast one because I can't imagine only seeing $50. However, it was rectified. Overall, a tad overpriced but a good meal.
